src:
Chelsea Vs Ajax, Frank Lampard: Malam yang Gila
06 Nov 2019, 02:02 by Terjemahan, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Laga antara Chelsea melawan Ajax Amsterdam di Liga Champions membuat manajer Frank Lampard kehabisan kata-kata. Ia mengatakan ada banyak kejadian yang terjadi di atas lapangan hanya dalam waktu satu malam.
"Hari ini hanya gila. Saya tidak berpikir ada terlalu banyak (peristiwa) sehingga dapat membandingkan dari pengalaman saya," kata manajer Chelsea itu usai laga di Stamford Bridge.
Di laga itu, Chelsea dan Ajax bermain imbang 4-4. The Blues sempat tertinggal di babak pertama sebelum akhirnya bisa mengimbangi. Tak hanya itu, Ajax harus bermain dengan sembilan orang, setelah Daley Blind dan Joel Veltman mendapat kartu merah di laga awal babak kedua.
Empat gol Chelsea datang dari Jorginho yang mencetak dua gol dari penalti (menit ke-4 dan 71), Cesar Azpilicueta (63), dan Reece James (74). Sementara gol-gol Ajax dicetak oleh Tammy Abraham (bunuh diri, menit ke-2), Quincy Promes (20), Kepa Arrizabalaga (bunuh diri, 35), dan Donny van de Beek (55).
Lampard mengaku salut dengan ketangguhan Ajax. Ia juga menghormati pasukan Erik ten Hag karena sudah memberikan perlawanan yang sengit.
"Saya tidak bisa menjelaskan pertandingan ini. Saya kira siapa pun yang menonton harus mengatakan permainan yang ditunjukkan sungguh luar biasa," sebut Lampard.
Lampard secara khusus menyoroti mental para pemainnya. Ia bangga karena Chelsea bisa bangkit saat tertinggal 1-4. "Karakter itu yang saya sukai. Dengan semangat itu kami bisa pergi ke berbagai tempat," tutur dia.
Di klasemen Grup H, tiga tim meraih poin sama, yakni Ajax, Chelsea, dan Valencia yang mengemas tujuh angka. Sementara Lille baru mengoleksi satu poin.

SKY SPORTS
text:
Chelsea v Ajax, Frank Lampard: Crazy night
Nov 6, 2019, 02:02 by the translation, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The match between Chelsea and Ajax Amsterdam in the Champions League leaves manager Frank Lampard at a loss for words. He said there were many events that took place on the field in just one night.
"Today is just crazy. I don't think there are too many (events) to be able to compare from my experience," said the Chelsea manager after the match at Stamford Bridge.
In that match, Chelsea and Ajax drew 4-4. The Blues had left in the first round before finally being able to compensate. Not only that, Ajax had to play with nine people, after Daley Blind and Joel Veltman received a red card at the beginning of the second half.
Chelsea's four goals came from Jorginho who scored two goals from penalties (minutes 4 and 71), Cesar Azpilicueta (63), and Reece James (74). While Ajax's goals were scored by Tammy Abraham (suicide, minute 2), Quincy Promes (20), Kepa Arrizabalaga (suicide, 35), and Donny van de Beek (55).
Lampard claimed to salute the toughness of Ajax. He also respected Erik ten Hag's troops for giving them fierce resistance.
"I can't explain this match. I think anyone who watches has to say the game shown is truly extraordinary," Lampard said.
Lampard specifically highlighted the mentality of his players. He is proud because Chelsea can rise when left behind 1-4. "That character is what I like. With that spirit we can go places," he said.
In the Group H standings, three teams won the same points, namely Ajax, Chelsea and Valencia who packed seven points. While Lille has only collected one point.

SKY SPORTS
